description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (s73) to vary Condition 2 of planning permission ref: 170634FUL dated 12/10/2017 for 'Conversion of residential building containing five flats into nine flats; single storey ground floor rear extension; excavation of basement to provide a rear lightwell and projecting bay window extension and associated safety balustrading; external alterations; raising of ground level to provide level access; and provision of cycle and refuse storage' Amendment seeking removal of proposed ramped external access and provision of internal access, changes to windows and doors, introduction of stepped hardscaping and privacy screening to rear ground floor flats
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission 170634FUL dated 12/10/2017.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 199/P/01; 199/P/02; 199/P/03; 199/P/04; 199/P/05; 199/P/06; 199/P/11 Rev. G; 199/P/12 Rev. H; 199/P/13 Rev. E; 199/P/14 Rev. C; 199/P/15 Rev. H; 199/P/16 Rev. H;

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials shall be in accordance with the materials described in the Application Form and Approved Plans as listed in Condition 2 of this decision.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shown in the submitted drawings shall be implemented and retained thereafter.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16. | A minimum of six (6) cycle parking spaces shall be provided within secured cycle storage facilities in accordance with the submitted drawings. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016).
